meanings.sent1: The baby's eye color was genetically determined by its parents' genes.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied how traits are genetically passed from one generation to the next.
meanings.sent3: The genetically identical twins always confused their friends with their similar looks.
meanings.sent4: The apple tree was genetically modified to resist pests and diseases.
meanings.sent5: The doctor explained that certain diseases can be genetically inherited from family members.

meanings.definition: In a manner determined by genetic factors.
meanings.sent1: The disease was genetically linked to a specific gene mutation.
meanings.sent2: The plant grew genetically stronger when exposed to sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The cat genetically preferred sleeping in the sunniest spot in the house.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's speed was genetically encoded in his DNA.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed genetically earlier this year due to the warm weather.

meanings.definition: Inherited or passed down through genes.
meanings.sent1: The family had a genetically inherited trait of having freckles.
meanings.sent2: The dog's behavior was genetically influenced by its breed.
meanings.sent3: The genetically gifted musician could play any instrument by ear.
meanings.sent4: The athlete's speed was genetically passed down from his father.
meanings.sent5: The plant's resistance to drought was genetically present in its seeds.
